articles.title: Japan Urged to Gain International Trust before Making Bid to Sit on UNSC
articles.content:
Photo Session Takes Place 
    Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The participants in the meeting of officials in the field of electricity and coal industries had a photo session at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace plaza on Nov. 28.
 They were overcome with the strong longing and profound veneration for President Kim Il Sung who set forth the Juche-oriented policy of electricity and coal industries, wisely led the struggle to build independent and modern electricity and coal industries and helped with warm care the electricity producers and coal miners glorify their honor of being performers of feats and innovators.    
 Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok, Kwak Pom Gi, Ro Tu Chol, Jon Sung Hun and officials concerned had a photo session with the participants who have devotedly worked to thoroughly implement the line and policy of the Workers' Party of Korea in the leading sectors of the national economy.

Picture Album on Korean Special Dishes Published
S. Korean Military Authorities Urged to Fulfill Their Responsibility before Times and Nation
articles.content:
Picture Album on Korean Special Dishes Published 
    Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Publishing House of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has published a picture album "Special Dishes of Korea".
 The picture album introduces mainly famous special dishes in different provinces of the country out of thousands of kinds of national food created and developed by the Koreans.    
 It consists of 9 parts -- Pyongyang City, Phyongan, Hamgyong, Hwanghae and Kangwon Provinces, Kaesong City and Kyonggi Province, Jolla, Chungchong and Kyongsang Provinces -- and an appendix -- national dishes according to the 12 months and folk holiday food.    
 It gives more than 200 kinds of photo-accompanied special dishes along with peculiarities, raw materials and cookery courses of the dishes.
 Featured in the album are origins of local special dishes, common knowledge on food that should not be taken together, and methods of flavoring tastes.
 The picture album will help the Korean people at home and abroad preserve the national identity in their dietary life.
